Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Flag Lot Setback Determination
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Defines setbacks and the front lot line for flag lots.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to lots configured as 'Flag lots'.
requirements: DIMENSIONS: lot_shape: 'flag_lot'

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Corner Lot Setback Determination
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Defines the street side setback for standard corner lots.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to lots with two adjacent street frontages, identified as 'Corner lots'.
requirements: MANDATORY: Lot must be a corner lot, with streets along two adjoining edges.
DIMENSIONS: lot_shape: 'corner_lot'

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Substandard Corner Lot Setback Exception
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Defines an exception for the street side setback on substandard corner lots.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to corner lots where one street frontage is less than 50 feet.
requirements: DIMENSIONS: frontage_width

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Through Lot Yard Identification
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Identifies the yard types for a through lot.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to lots with street frontage on two opposite, parallel sides.
requirements: MANDATORY: Lot must have streets on opposite, parallel sides.
DIMENSIONS: lot_shape: 'through_lot'

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Wedge Shaped Lot Rear Yard Determination
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Defines the method for determining the rear yard on a wedge-shaped lot, which lacks a rear lot line.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to lots identified as 'Wedge shaped'.
requirements: DIMENSIONS: lot_shape: 'wedge_shaped_lot'

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Rear Lot Line Determination for Lots with more than 4 sides
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Defines the method for determining the rear lot line on a lot with more than four sides.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to lots with more than four sides (as depicted in Figures F and G).
requirements: MANDATORY: Lot must have more than 4 sides.
DIMENSIONS: number_of_sides: > 4

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Basement Floor Area Exemption from FAR
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Regulation of building mass and the appearance of the streetscape through floor area calculations.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to basements, including habitable ones, when calculating total floor area (FAR).
requirements: MANDATORY: The basement must be below grade to be considered for exemption.
DIMENSIONS: Height of the first floor above grade.

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Bay Window Exclusion from Gross Floor Area Calculation
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Defines the criteria under which a bay window is considered a decorative architectural feature and is excluded from the calculation of gross floor area.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to bay windows as architectural relief features in residential house designs.
requirements: MANDATORY: All three design criteria must be met simultaneously for the exclusion to apply: 1. Bottom of feature must be at least 18 inches above the floor joists. 2. Exterior supports must be non-solid features like corbels/brackets. 3. At least 50% of the surface must be glass. (Ambiguity Flag: 'surface' is not precisely defined, but examples suggest vertical faces).
VALUES: Minimum height above floor joists: 18 inches. Minimum glass surface percentage: 50%. Maximum projection from facade: 2 feet.
DIMENSIONS: 1. Height of the bay window's bottom relative to the floor joists. 2. Percentage of the bay window's surface area that is glass. 3. Projection distance from the building facade.

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Gross Floor Area Calculation for Upper Floor Outdoor Areas
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Determination of which outdoor areas on upper floors are counted towards the Gross Floor Area (GFA).
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to all balconies, decks, and other outdoor areas located on upper floors of a building. The rule also explicitly applies to 'pop-out balconies'.
requirements: MANDATORY: Outdoor areas on upper levels that are determined to be 'roofed' MUST be counted toward the gross floor area.
DIMENSIONS: eave_depth_over_area, eave_depth_over_rest_of_building, overhang_width_over_balcony, overhang_width_around_rest_of_house

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Porch Openness Calculation for Gross Floor Area
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Determination of whether a porch's area is included in the Gross Floor Area (GFA) calculation.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to the perimeter of porches.

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Max Height for Main Dwelling on Standard Lot with Low Roof Slope
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Regulation of maximum building height measured to the roof peak.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to a 'Main dwelling' on a 'standard lot' where the roof slope is less than 12:12.
requirements: MANDATORY: The structure's height to the roof peak must not exceed the specified maximum height.

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Max Height for Main Dwelling on Standard Lot with High Roof Slope
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Regulation of maximum building height measured to the roof peak.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to a 'Main dwelling' on a 'standard lot' where the roof slope is greater than or equal to 12:12.
requirements: MANDATORY: The structure's height to the roof peak must not exceed the specified maximum height.

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Max Height for Main Dwelling on Substandard or Flag Lot
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Regulation of maximum building height measured to the roof peak.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to a 'Main dwelling' on a 'substandard' or 'flag' lot.
requirements: MANDATORY: The structure's height to the roof peak must not exceed the specified maximum height.

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Accessory Structure in Rear Yard (Side Lot Line)
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Site planning for accessory structures.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to accessory structures (e.g., garage, pool cabana) located in the rear yard of an interior lot.
requirements: MANDATORY: IF structure is located in rear yard, THEN distance from front lot line must be >= 75 feet. IF structure is located in rear yard, THEN height must be <= 12 feet. IF structure is located in rear yard, THEN it must comply with accessory structure daylight plane. IF structure is located at the side lot line, THEN the adjacent wall and roof must be fire rated.
DIMENSIONS: distance_from_front_lot_line, height, location_relative_to_side_lot_line

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Large Accessory Structure in Rear Yard (Rear Lot Line)
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Site planning and permitting for accessory structures.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to accessory structures located in the rear yard that are over a certain size and contain multiple plumbing fixtures.
requirements: MANDATORY: IF structure is located in rear yard, THEN distance from front lot line must be >= 75 feet. IF structure is located in rear yard, THEN height must be <= 12 feet. IF structure is located in rear yard, THEN it must comply with accessory structure daylight plane. IF structure is located at the rear lot line, THEN the adjacent wall and roof must be fire rated.
DIMENSIONS: distance_from_front_lot_line, height, location_relative_to_rear_lot_line, area_in_sf

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Accessory Structure in Buildable Area
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Site planning for accessory structures.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to accessory structures located entirely within the designated buildable area of a lot.
requirements: DIMENSIONS: number_of_stories

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Floor Area Calculation for Unenclosed Porches
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Determination of what counts as floor area.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to unenclosed porches.
requirements: MANDATORY: The porch must be unenclosed.

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Floor Area Calculation for Enclosed Porches
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Determination of what counts as floor area.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to enclosed porches.
requirements: MANDATORY: The porch must be enclosed.

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Floor Area Calculation for Low-Height Entry Features
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Determination of what counts as floor area.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to entry features with a height of 12 feet or less.
requirements: DIMENSIONS: Height of the entry feature.

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Floor Area Calculation for High-Height Entry Features
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Determination of what counts as floor area.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to entry features with a height greater than 12 feet.
requirements: DIMENSIONS: Height of the entry feature.

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Floor Area Calculation for 1st Floor Recessed Porches
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Determination of what counts as floor area.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to recessed porches on the 1st floor that are open on an exterior side and have a limited depth.
requirements: DIMENSIONS: Depth of the porch, Floor level.

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Floor Area Calculation for 2nd Floor Roofed or Enclosed Features
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Determination of what counts as floor area.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to 2nd floor roofed or enclosed porches, arcades, balconies, porticos, and breezeways.
requirements: MANDATORY: Feature must be on the 2nd floor and be one of the specified types (porch, arcade, etc.) and be roofed or enclosed.
DIMENSIONS: Floor level.

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Floor Area Calculation for Low-Height Attic Space
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Determination of what counts as floor area.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to attic space where the vertical distance from the floor to the underside of the roof rafter is 5 feet or less.
requirements: DIMENSIONS: Height from floor to underside of roof rafter.

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Floor Area Calculation for Standard 2nd Floor Space and Attics
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Determination of what counts as floor area.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to all 2nd floor space, including attics, where head height is 5 feet or greater.
requirements: DIMENSIONS: Head height (top of floor to bottom of rafter), Floor level.

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Floor Area Calculation for 2nd Floor Equivalent (High Volume)
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Determination of what counts as floor area, with penalties for high-volume spaces.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to areas where the height from the top of the first floor to the top of the roof material is greater than 17 feet.
requirements: DIMENSIONS: Height from top of first floor to top of roof material.

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Floor Area Calculation for 3rd Floor Equivalent (Very High Volume)
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Determination of what counts as floor area, with penalties for very high-volume spaces.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to areas where the height from the top of the first floor to the top of the roof material is 26 feet or greater.
requirements: DIMENSIONS: Height from top of first floor to top of roof material.

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Floor Area Calculation for Compliant Basements
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Determination of what counts as floor area.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to basements that comply with specific patio and lightwell requirements.

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Floor Area Calculation for Basements in Historic Structures
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Determination of what counts as floor area.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to basements of Category 1 & 2 historic homes or contributing structures in a historic district.

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Floor Area Calculation for Bay Windows
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Determination of what counts as floor area.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to bay windows that meet a specific set of dimensional and material criteria.
requirements: DIMENSIONS: Height above interior floor, Projection distance from wall.

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Floor Area Calculation for Architectural Appendages
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Determination of what counts as floor area.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to the footprint of architectural appendages such as fireplaces or buttresses.
requirements: MANDATORY: The footprint of a fireplace or buttress is counted once.
DIMENSIONS: Footprint area.

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Floor Area Calculation for Large Accessory Structures
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Determination of what counts as floor area.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to accessory structures with a floor area greater than 120 square feet.
requirements: DIMENSIONS: Area of the accessory structure.

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Floor Area Calculation for Garages and Carports
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Determination of what counts as floor area.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to garages and carports.
requirements: MANDATORY: The area of a garage or carport is counted once.

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Floor Area Calculation for Porte Cocheres
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Determination of what counts as floor area.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to porte cocheres.
requirements: MANDATORY: The area of a porte cochere is not counted.

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Minimum & Maximum Lot Sizes for New Lots
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Defines the dimensional requirements (width, depth, area) for the creation of new lots via subdivision.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to new lots created under the subdivision ordinance in the following zones: R-1, R-1(7000), R-1(8000), R-1(10000), R-1(20000).
requirements: MANDATORY: A new lot must satisfy all of the following: (width >= 60 ft) AND (depth >= 100 ft) AND (lot_area is within the min/max range for its specific zone district).

VALUES: Minimum width: 60 ft
Minimum depth: 100 ft
Lot Area Ranges (sf):
- R-1: Min 6,000; Max 9,999
- R-1(7000): Min 7,000; Max 13,999
- R-1(8000): Min 8,000; Max 15,999
- R-1(10000): Min 10,000; Max 19,999
- R-1(20000): Min 20,000; Max 39,999
DIMENSIONS: lot_width (ft), lot_depth (ft), lot_area (sf)

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Definition of a Substandard Lot
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Defines the dimensional criteria used to classify an existing lot as 'substandard'.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to lots within all R-1 zones: R-1, R-1(7000), R-1(8000), R-1(10000), R-1(20000).
requirements:
VALUES: Substandard width threshold: < 50 ft
Substandard depth threshold: < 83 ft
Area Thresholds (sf) - A lot is substandard if its area is less than or equal to these values:
- R-1: Typical 4,980; Flag 5,976
- R-1(7000): Typical 5,810; Flag 6,972
- R-1(8000): Typical 6,640; Flag 7,968
- R-1(10000): Typical 8,300; Flag 9,960
- R-1(20000): Typical 16,600; Flag 19,920
DIMENSIONS: lot_width (ft), lot_depth (ft), lot_area (sf)

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Special Regulations for Substandard Lots
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Specifies alternative development regulations for building height, setbacks, and garage placement on substandard lots.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies only to lots that have been classified as 'substandard' based on the official definition.
requirements:
VALUES: Max building height: 17 ft (single-story)
Required street-side yard: 10 ft
Standard building height (for comparison): 30 ft
Standard street-side yard (for comparison): 16 ft
Standard garage location (for comparison): 75 ft back from front lot line
DIMENSIONS: building_height (ft), street_side_yard (ft), lot_width (ft), lot_depth (ft), garage_location

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Vaulted Entryway Gross Floor Area Calculation
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Calculation of Gross Floor Area (GFA).
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to entryways that are 'considered to be a vaulted entryway'. The provided example shows a portion of the entryway recessed beyond the house facade and roof.

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Vaulted Entryway with 2nd Floor Gross Floor Area Calculation
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Calculation of Gross Floor Area (GFA).
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to a vaulted entry that has a 2nd floor located over it.

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Driveway Dimensional Standards
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Regulates the minimum width and clearance for driveways.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: All driveways, noted as 'typ. all' in Figure 31.
requirements: MANDATORY: Driveway surface must be at least 8' wide. Driveway clearance must be at least 10' wide.
DIMENSIONS: Driveway surface width, Driveway clearance width.

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Recessed Porch Gross Floor Area Exclusion
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Calculation of Gross Floor Area (GFA).
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to recessed porches located on the ground floor (1st floor).
requirements: MANDATORY: To be excluded from GFA, a logical AND of three conditions must be met.

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Vaulted Entry Feature Definition and Gross Floor Area (GFA) Calculation
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: This rule defines 'vaulted entry features' and stipulates how their area is calculated towards the gross floor area.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to all building entry features.
requirements: MANDATORY: If an entry feature meets the height criteria for a 'vaulted entry feature', its footprint area MUST be counted twice towards the gross floor area.

DIMENSIONS: entry_feature_height: The vertical distance of the entry feature. entry_feature_footprint_area: The floor area of the entry feature. gross_floor_area: The total gross floor area of the building.

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Setback Determination for Oddly Shaped Lots
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Provides a reference for determining appropriate site plans and setbacks for non-standard lot shapes.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to 'flag lot' (Fig 17 A), 'corner lot' (Fig 17 B), 'through lot' (Fig 17 D), 'wedge-shaped lot' (Fig 17 E), and 'lot with more than four sides' (Fig 17 F & G).

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Reduced Setbacks for Flag and Substandard Lots
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Describes specific instances of reduced setbacks for smaller or oddly shaped lots.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to 'flag lots' and 'substandard corner lots that are less than 50' wide'.

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: GFA Calculation for Roofed Balconies/Outdoor Areas on Upper Floors
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Assessment of gross floor area (GFA) for porches, entryways, and balconies.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to roofed balconies or other roofed outdoor areas on upper floors (i.e., floor level > 1).

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Attached Fireplace, Chimney, and Buttress Gross Floor Area Calculation
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Calculation of gross floor area (GFA) for fireplaces, chimneys, and buttresses attached to a primary structure.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to all configurations and designs of attached fireplaces, chimneys, and buttresses.
requirements: MANDATORY: Fireplaces, ground-floor chimneys, and buttresses must be counted towards GFA.
DIMENSIONS: Configuration, design, floor level.

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Projections and Appendages Gross Floor Area Calculation
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Calculation of gross floor area (GFA) for sheds, planters, tool sheds, equipment enclosures, play houses, and other similar projections/appendages.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to miscellaneous appendages and projections regardless of configuration or design.
requirements: DIMENSIONS: Height.

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Gross vs. net lot area
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Defines the calculation of net lot area from gross lot area. The net lot area is the basis for determining a lot's development potential.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to all lots in Palo Alto, specifically lots where portions must be excluded from the gross lot area. This includes lots with street right-of-ways, flag lots, and lots with creek channels.
requirements: MANDATORY: The following areas MUST be excluded from the gross lot size to establish net lot area: 1. Street right-of-way. 2. 'Pole' portion of a flag lot. 3. Creek channel.

DIMENSIONS: Gross lot area: The total size of the lot from lot line to lot line. Net lot area: The area used for calculating development potential, derived from the gross lot area. Area A: The portion of a lot within a public street right-of-way (ROW). Area B: The 'pole' portion of a flag lot. Area C: The portion of a lot within a creek channel.

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Uncovered Parking Space Dimensions
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Minimum dimensions for parking spaces.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Uncovered parking spaces.
requirements: MANDATORY: The specified minimum dimensions must be met.

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Parking Space Clear Area Usage
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Use of the required clear area within a parking space.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: All required parking spaces, both covered and uncovered.
requirements: MANDATORY: The clear area required for a parking space must be free of other uses or obstructions.

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Attic, closet, & perimeter spaces contributing to Gross Floor Area
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: This rule defines how to calculate the contribution of certain spaces (attics, closets, perimeters) to the total gross floor area of a structure.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: The rule applies to all accessible floors in a structure.
requirements: MANDATORY: On any accessible floor, any area with at least 5 feet of head clearance must be counted toward the gross floor area.
DIMENSIONS: head clearance, gross floor area, floor area

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Maximum Size of Detached Second Dwelling Unit
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Establishes the maximum permissible floor area for a detached second dwelling unit.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to all 'Detached 2nd dwelling units'.
requirements: MANDATORY: The area of the detached second dwelling unit must not exceed the maximum limit.
VALUES: 900 sf max
DIMENSIONS: Gross floor area of the second dwelling unit.

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Maximum Size of Single-Car Garage for Second Dwelling Unit (Ambiguous)
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Establishes a maximum permissible floor area for a single-car garage associated with a second dwelling unit.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Appears to apply to 1-car garages serving a second dwelling unit, whether attached or detached, as labels are noted in both Scenarios A and B.
requirements: MANDATORY: If applicable, the garage area must not exceed the maximum limit.
VALUES: 200 sf max (Value is faint and not confirmed with certainty)
DIMENSIONS: Gross floor area of the garage.

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Vaulted Entryway Area Calculation for Gross Floor Area
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Defines the method for calculating the floor area of a specific type of entryway and its contribution to the total gross floor area of a building.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: This rule applies to entryways that are classified as 'vaulted'.

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Standards for Accessory Structures in the Buildable Area
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Height and daylight plane regulations for accessory structures.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies only to non-dwelling accessory structures located within the 'buildable area' of a lot.

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Siting of Detached Garages/Carports on Shallow Lots
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: An exception to the general siting rule for detached parking structures on shallow lots.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to detached garages and carports on lots that are less than 95' deep.
requirements: MANDATORY: Structure must be located in the rear or interior side yard.
VALUES: 95' (maximum lot depth for this rule to apply).
DIMENSIONS: Lot depth; Location on lot (rear half); Location in yard (rear or interior side).

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Fire-Rated Construction for Garages at Lot Line
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Construction requirements for garages built with zero setback to a lot line.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to garages located 'at the lot line'.
requirements: DIMENSIONS: Distance from lot line (must be 0).

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Garage Size Substitution
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Allows for substitution of a smaller garage if sufficient uncovered parking is available.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to lots where a 2-car garage is being considered.
requirements: VALUES: 1-car; 2-car.

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Lot Coverage
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Describes how much of a lot is covered by structures, without evaluating the mass of those structures.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to the calculation of the total footprint of all structures on a lot.
requirements: MANDATORY: The total lot coverage must not exceed the maximum allowable percentage of the lot size.

Phase 1 - Site Analysis.rule_title: Gross Floor Area (GFA)
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.scope: Describes the mass of structures by reflecting the cumulative square footage of all visible levels.
Phase 1 - Site Analysis.applicability: Applies to the calculation of the sum of all floor areas in structures on a lot, measured to the outside of exterior stud walls.
requirements: MANDATORY: The total gross floor area must not exceed the calculated allowable maximum. The main house GFA must not exceed 6,000 sf, regardless of lot size.

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Daylight Plane Protrusion: Television and Radio Antennas
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Regulates the protrusion of television and radio antennas above the maximum building height in relation to the daylight plane.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies to television and radio antennas.
requirements: MANDATORY: The protrusion must not exceed 15 feet above the maximum building height.
VALUES: Maximum protrusion: 15 feet
DIMENSIONS: protrusion_height_above_max_building_height

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Daylight Plane Protrusion: Chimneys and Flues
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Regulates the protrusion of small chimneys and flues into the daylight plane.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies to chimneys and flues that are less than 5 feet wide.
requirements: MANDATORY: Chimney or flue width must be less than 5 feet.
VALUES: Maximum width for applicability: < 5 feet
DIMENSIONS: chimney_flue_width, protrusion_extent

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Daylight Plane Protrusion: Dormers, Roof Decks, Gables
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Regulates the protrusion of certain architectural features like dormers, roof decks, and gables into the daylight plane.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies to dormers, roof decks, gables, or 'similar architectural features'. AMBIGUITY: The term 'similar' is not defined.
requirements: MANDATORY: All dimensional and separation constraints must be met simultaneously. 1) each feature length ≤ 7.5'; 2) cumulative length of all features ≤ 15' (per side); 3) min 5' separation between features (per side); 4) height ≤ 24'. AMBIGUITY: The context for 'height ≤ 24'' is unclear (e.g., height of the feature, height above roof, etc.).
VALUES: Max individual length: 7.5 feet; Max cumulative length: 15 feet (per side); Min separation: 5 feet (per side); Max height: 24 feet
DIMENSIONS: individual_feature_length, cumulative_feature_length_per_side, separation_between_features_per_side, feature_height

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Daylight Plane Protrusion: Cornices and Eaves
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Regulates the protrusion of non-habitable architectural features like cornices and eaves into the daylight plane.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies to cornices, eaves, and 'similar architectural features'. AMBIGUITY: The term 'similar' is not defined.
requirements: MANDATORY: Protrusion must not exceed 2 feet. The feature must not be a flat/continuous wall or an enclosure for interior space.
VALUES: Maximum protrusion: 2 feet
DIMENSIONS: protrusion_depth

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Excavated Features and Grade Measurement for FAR
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Defines how excavated features affect the determination of 'grade' for the purpose of floor area (FAR) calculations.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Excavated features including light wells, stairwells, and below-grade patios.
requirements: DIMENSIONS: Size and dimensional limits of excavated features.

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Roofed Porch Definition
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Defines a type of structure, the 'Roofed porch', as illustrated in Figure 4.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Structures classified as 'A Roofed porch'.
requirements: MANDATORY: No specific constraints are listed on this page for this type.
DIMENSIONS: Height

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Roofed Entry Way (not vaulted) Height Regulation
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Regulates the maximum height of non-vaulted roofed entryways.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Structures classified as 'B Roofed entry way (not vaulted)'.
requirements: MANDATORY: The height of the structure must be less than 12 feet above grade.
DIMENSIONS: Height

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Vaulted Entry Way Height Regulation
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Regulates the minimum height of vaulted entryways.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Structures classified as 'C Vaulted entry way'.
requirements: MANDATORY: The height of the structure must be greater than 12 feet above grade.
DIMENSIONS: Height

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Combination Porch & Vaulted Entry Way Height Regulation
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Regulates the minimum height of combination porch and vaulted entryway structures.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Structures classified as 'D Combination porch & vaulted entry way'.
requirements: MANDATORY: The height of the structure must be greater than 12 feet above grade.
DIMENSIONS: Height

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Accessory structure daylight plane (sides & rear)
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Defines the maximum allowable building envelope for accessory structures on a lot.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies to accessory structures, specifically concerning their proximity to side and rear lot lines.

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Porch Safety Railing Height and GFA Classification
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Safety requirements for porch sides and their impact on the 'open' vs. 'closed' classification used for GFA calculations.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies to porches where the porch floor is more than 30 inches above grade.

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Main Dwelling - Rear Yard Encroachment
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Allowable setback encroachments for a portion of the main dwelling at the rear of the structure.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies to the 1st floor (ground floor) only. Applies only to legally constructed structures. The addition must be contiguous with an existing protrusion.
requirements: MANDATORY: The encroaching portion's width must be no wider than half the maximum width of the dwelling. The encroachment must be on the ground floor only. The addition must be contiguous with any existing protrusion.
DIMENSIONS: lot_type (standard lot, back-to-back corner lot), structure_max_width, encroachment_width, encroachment_depth, maintained_setback

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Main Dwelling - Front Setback Encroachment Extension
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Allowable extension of an existing front setback encroachment for a main dwelling.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies to the 1st floor only. Requires an existing, legal front setback encroachment to extend.
requirements: MANDATORY: Must be an extension of an existing front setback encroachment. Must be on the 1st floor.
DIMENSIONS: distance_to_front_lot_line

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Main Dwelling - Interior-Side Setback Encroachment Extension
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Allowable extension of an existing interior-side setback encroachment for a main dwelling.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies to the 1st floor only. Requires an existing, legal interior-side setback encroachment to extend.
requirements: MANDATORY: Must be an extension of an existing interior-side setback encroachment. Must be on the 1st floor.
DIMENSIONS: distance_to_interior_side_lot_line

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Main Dwelling - Street-Side Setback Encroachment Extension
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Allowable extension of an existing street-side setback encroachment for a main dwelling.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies to the 1st floor only. Requires an existing, legal street-side setback encroachment to extend.
requirements: MANDATORY: Must be an extension of an existing street-side setback encroachment. Must be on the 1st floor.
DIMENSIONS: distance_to_street_side_lot_line

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Porches and Entry Features - Balconies, Porches, Stairways, Fire Escapes
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Allowable setback encroachments for specific 1st floor features.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies to 1st floor balconies, uncovered porches, stairways, and fire escapes.
requirements: MANDATORY: Feature must be on the 1st floor. Feature must be one of: balcony, uncovered porch, stairway, or fire escape.
DIMENSIONS: encroachment_depth

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Porches and Entry Features - Canopies and Patio Covers
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Allowable placement for canopies and patio covers.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies to canopies and patio covers on the 1st floor only.
requirements: MANDATORY: Feature must be on the 1st floor. Feature must be a canopy or patio cover.

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Other Features - 1st Floor Bay/Greenhouse Windows
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Allowable setback encroachments for specific window types in front and rear yards.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies to 1st floor bay or greenhouse windows that are composed of a window surface, are cantilevered, and have no floor joists.
requirements: MANDATORY: Must be on the 1st floor. Must be a bay or greenhouse window. Must be composed of a window surface. Must be cantilevered. Must have no floor joists.
DIMENSIONS: encroachment_depth

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Other Features - Greenhouse Windows (Side Yard)
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Allowable setback encroachments for greenhouse windows in side yards.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies only to greenhouse windows.
requirements: MANDATORY: Feature must be a greenhouse window.
DIMENSIONS: encroachment_depth

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Max Height for Accessory Structure in Yard
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Regulation of maximum building height measured to the roof peak.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies to an 'Accessory structure' located in a 'rear' or 'side' yard.
requirements: MANDATORY: The structure's height to the roof peak must not exceed the specified maximum height.

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Max Height for 2nd-Dwelling Units
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Regulation of maximum building height measured to the roof peak.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies to '2nd-dwelling units'.
requirements: MANDATORY: The structure's height to the roof peak must not exceed the specified maximum height.

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Two-Story Accessory Structure Requirements
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Site planning and review process for accessory structures.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies to any accessory structure that is two stories high, or is a new second-floor addition.
requirements: MANDATORY: IF an accessory structure is 2 stories, THEN it MUST be located within the buildable area. IF an accessory structure is 2 stories OR is a new 2nd floor addition, THEN it is subject to Individual Review (IR).
DIMENSIONS: number_of_stories

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Garage Setback Exception
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Site planning for parking structures.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies ONLY to garages located in rear or side yards.
requirements: DIMENSIONS: lot_depth, distance_from_front_lot_line

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Attached Garage/Carport Setbacks
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Site planning regulations for attached vehicle storage structures.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies to attached garages and attached carports.
requirements: MANDATORY: Compliance is mandatory. The text uses the word 'must'.

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Standard Setbacks by Zone
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Defines minimum required yard dimensions (front, rear, interior side, street side) for lots, creating a buildable area and surrounding open space.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies in 'most cases' to specific residential zones (R-1, R-1(7000), R-1(8000), R-1(10000), R-1(20000)), flag lots, substandard lots, and substandard corner lots.
requirements: MANDATORY: Required yards must be maintained as open space areas.

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Special Setbacks
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Defines specific setback requirements that supersede standard setbacks for lots located on a pre-defined list of streets.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies to lots on the following streets: Alma St, Arastradero Rd, Ash St, California Ave.
requirements: MANDATORY: Special setbacks override standard setbacks.

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Exemption to 3rd Floor Equivalent for Steep Roof Pitch
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Provides a partial exemption from the '3rd floor equivalent' calculation.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies to areas subject to the '3rd floor equivalent' rule where the roof pitch is 4:12 or greater.
requirements: DIMENSIONS: Roof pitch.

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Determination of Porch Openness Percentage
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Procedure to determine if a roofed porch is considered 'open' based on the ratio of its open perimeter segments to its total perimeter.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Roofed porches on the 1st floor.

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: 2nd & 3rd floor equivalency
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Calculation of gross floor area (GFA).
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies to high-volume spaces within a building, measured vertically from the top of the first finished floor.
requirements: MANDATORY: Areas higher than 17' above the first floor must be counted as 2nd floor equivalency GFA. Areas higher than 26' above the first floor must be counted as 3rd floor equivalency GFA.
DIMENSIONS: height_above_first_floor, area_of_high_volume_space, roof_pitch, width_of_area

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Primary Daylight Plane (Sides)
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: An invisible tent-like plane intended to contain development on a lot in a way that preserves privacy and exposure to natural light for adjacent properties. It works in conjunction with setbacks and height limits.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Regulates structures located within the buildable area.
requirements: MANDATORY: Structures within the buildable area must be contained within the primary daylight plane.
DIMENSIONS: Average grade; Existing grade of the structure (at midpoint of wall); Grade at the nearest point on the adjacent lot; Max. building height.

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Front Yard Impermeable Surface Limitation
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Limits the amount of impermeable surface area within the boundaries of the required front yard.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: The required front yard of all properties subject to this regulation.
requirements: MANDATORY: No more than 40% of the required front yard may be impermeable.
DIMENSIONS: Total area of required front yard, Total area of impermeable surface within the front yard.

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: One-Story Construction Height and 2nd Story Equivalency
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Defines the height limit for one-story construction for the purpose of GFA calculation.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: City-wide policy applied to spaces like porches when their area is included in GFA calculations.
requirements: MANDATORY: This is a mandatory city policy for GFA calculation.

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Extension of existing side yard encroachment
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Allowable extensions to existing encroachments of walls into required yards.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies to existing walls that encroach into a required interior side yard. The extension is permitted on the ground floor only. This rule applies only to structures that were legally constructed without a variance or a home improvement exception (HIE). The extension may be performed only once in the life of the structure.
requirements: MANDATORY: The existing wall must be at least 5'-0" from the property line. The extension must be at the same setback as the existing wall. The extension must be contiguous with the existing protrusion. The original non-complying wall must be retained.

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Extension of existing front yard encroachment
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Allowable extensions to existing encroachments of walls into required yards.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies to existing walls that encroach into a required front yard. The extension is permitted on the ground floor only. This rule applies only to structures that were legally constructed without a variance or a home improvement exception (HIE). The extension may be performed only once in the life of the structure.
requirements: MANDATORY: The existing wall must be at least 14'-0" from the property line. The extension must be at the same setback as the existing wall. The extension must be contiguous with the existing protrusion. The original non-complying wall must be retained. Both of the following provisions must be met: 1) the length of the extension is no greater than that of the existing encroaching wall, AND 2) the combined length is no greater than one-half the maximum width of the house.

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Extension of existing street-side yard encroachment
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Allowable extensions to existing encroachments of walls into required yards.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies to existing walls that encroach into a required street side yard. The extension is permitted on the ground floor only. This rule applies only to structures that were legally constructed without a variance or a home improvement exception (HIE). The extension may be performed only once in the life of the structure.
requirements: MANDATORY: The existing wall must be at least 10'-0" from the property line. The extension must be at the same setback as the existing wall. The extension must be contiguous with the existing protrusion. The original non-complying wall must be retained.

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Structure Height Measurement on Land with Natural Slope ≤ 10%
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Measurement of structure height.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies to structures located on land with a natural slope of 10% or less.
requirements: MANDATORY: This rule is invoked when measuring the height of a structure.
DIMENSIONS: Structure height, Natural slope of land

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Structure Height Measurement on Land with Natural Slope > 10%
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Measurement of structure height and enforcement of height limits.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies to structures located on land with a natural slope greater than 10%.
requirements: MANDATORY: This rule is invoked when measuring the height of a structure. The structure must comply with the height limit at all points along the slope.
DIMENSIONS: Structure height, Natural slope of land

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Daylight Plane Measurement
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Measurement of a daylight plane.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies when measuring a daylight plane.
requirements: MANDATORY: This rule is invoked when measuring a daylight plane.
DIMENSIONS: Daylight plane

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Setback Measurement with Easements
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Defines the origin point for setback measurements when specific easements are present on a lot.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies to lots with 'Creek easements' or 'Public street easements'.
requirements: MANDATORY: If a 'Creek easement' or 'Public street easement' exists, the setback MUST be measured from the edge of the easement, regardless of the lot line location.

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Setback Measurement with Sidewalks
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Defines the origin point for setback measurements in relation to sidewalks and the public right-of-way.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies to lots adjacent to a public sidewalk.
requirements: MANDATORY: The setback must be measured from the lot line, not the sidewalk.

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Primary Daylight Plane (Rear)
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Regulation of the building envelope at the rear of a property to ensure daylight access.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies to the rear of a building. The plane is measured from the rear setback line.

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Maximum Building Height
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Defines the maximum allowable vertical height of a structure.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies to all structures, with different limits based on roof slope, lot type, and location within a flood zone.

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Rear Protrusions into Daylight Plane
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Regulates the dimensions, spacing, and cumulative size of building elements that are permitted to extend into the required rear daylight plane.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies to protrusions on the rear facade of a building that penetrate the daylight plane.

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: GFA Calculation for Non-Roofed Features
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Assessment of gross floor area (GFA) for porches, entryways, and balconies.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies to non-roofed porches, entryways, balconies, and similar features.

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: GFA Calculation for Roofed Porches on 1st Floor
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Assessment of gross floor area (GFA) for porches, entryways, and balconies.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies to roofed porches located on the 1st floor.

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: GFA Calculation for Low-Height Roofed Entry Features on 1st Floor
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Assessment of gross floor area (GFA) for porches, entryways, and balconies.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies to roofed entry features on the 1st floor that are less than 12 feet high from grade.

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: GFA Calculation for High-Height (Vaulted) Roofed Entry Features on 1st Floor
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Assessment of gross floor area (GFA) for porches, entryways, and balconies.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies to roofed entry features on the 1st floor that are more than 12 feet high from grade. These are termed 'vaulted entry feature'.

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: GFA Calculation for Recessed Porches on 1st Floor
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Assessment of gross floor area (GFA) for porches, entryways, and balconies.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies to recessed porches on the 1st floor.

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Average Grade Calculation for Daylight Plane Height Measurement
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Determining the reference point (average grade) for measuring the height of a structure relative to the daylight plane.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies when measuring daylight plane height, as depicted in Figure 21.
requirements: MANDATORY: This calculation method is mandatory for determining the measurement datum for daylight plane height.
DIMENSIONS: height (of daylight plane); grade_at_midpoint_of_building; grade_at_closest_point_on_abutting_site; average_grade.

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Allowable Eave Protrusion and Daylight Plane Clearance
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Regulates the maximum protrusion of eaves from the wall plane and specifies clearance requirements relative to the daylight plane.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies to eaves on structures subject to daylight plane regulations, as shown in Figure 22.
requirements: MANDATORY: The 2-foot maximum eave protrusion is a mandatory limit. The daylight plane clearance requirement is also mandatory.
DIMENSIONS: eave_protrusion_distance (from wall plane).

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Certification of Daylight Plane Compliance
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Defines the procedural requirement for providing a formal certification of compliance with daylight plane provisions.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies to any person building or making improvements to a structure.
requirements: MANDATORY: Providing the certification is mandatory once requested.
DIMENSIONS: None specified.

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Minimum Rear Yard Setback for Second Dwelling Unit (Ambiguous)
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Defines a minimum setback dimension in the rear yard for a detached second dwelling unit.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies to detached second dwelling units located in the rear yard on an interior lot.
requirements: MANDATORY: The detached second dwelling unit must be placed at or beyond this minimum setback from the rear lot line.
VALUES: TBD feet (' min). (Value is not legible in the source text).
DIMENSIONS: Minimum distance from the rear lot line.

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Standards for Accessory Structures in the Required Setback
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Regulations for accessory structures located within the required setback area of a lot.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies only to non-dwelling accessory structures located in the 'required setback' area.

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Stricter Daylight Plane for Setback Exceptions
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Height and massing regulation for structures using specific setback rules.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies to any garage or carport that takes advantage of the setback exceptions (either the 75'/20' rule or the shallow lot rule).
requirements: DIMENSIONS: Daylight plane profile.

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Setback for Open-Sided Carports
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Minimum setback requirements for open-sided carports from lot lines.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies to carports with open sides.
requirements: VALUES: 3' (minimum distance from any lot line).
DIMENSIONS: Distance from any lot line.

Phase 2 - Building Design.rule_title: Contextual front setbacks
Phase 2 - Building Design.scope: Regulation for determining the required front setback of a property based on the existing setbacks of neighboring lots.
Phase 2 - Building Design.applicability: Applies to lots on a block where the calculated average of existing setbacks on the same side of the block is 30 feet or greater.
requirements: MANDATORY: A contextual setback calculation can only be initiated if the block (or relevant 600' segment) has more than 3 lots, including the project lot.

VALUES: Setback average threshold: 30 ft
Block length limit for special consideration: 600 ft
Lot count limit for long blocks: 10 lots
Minimum lot count for calculation: > 3 lots
Lot count threshold for excluding smallest/largest setbacks: >= 5 lots
Multi-family unit count for exclusion: >= 3 units
DIMENSIONS: existing_setback_depth (ft), block_length (ft), calculated_average_setback (ft)

Phase 3 - Parking & Access.scope: This rule governs the placement of garages on a lot, specifically whether they should be in the front or rear half, based on the existing neighborhood pattern.
Phase 3 - Parking & Access.applicability: The rule applies if, and only if, a predominant neighborhood pattern exists. A pattern is 'predominant' when more than half of the contributing lots fall into a single category (either front-half or rear-half).
requirements: MANDATORY: If a predominant pattern is established, all new projects on that block must place the garage according to that pattern.
DIMENSIONS: block_length, distance_from_subject_lot, lot_position (front-half vs rear-half)

Phase 3 - Parking & Access.scope: Allowable placement of detached accessory structures in rear or side yards.
Phase 3 - Parking & Access.applicability: Applies to detached accessory structures.
requirements: MANDATORY: Structure must be located at least 75 feet from the front lot line AND at least 20 feet from the street-side lot line.
DIMENSIONS: distance_from_front_lot_line, distance_from_street_side_lot_line

Phase 3 - Parking & Access.scope: Allowable placement of detached accessory structures used for covered parking.
Phase 3 - Parking & Access.applicability: Applies to detached structures for covered parking on lots of a specific depth.
requirements: MANDATORY: Structure must be for covered parking AND located on a lot ≤ 95 feet deep AND be at least 25 feet from the street-side lot line AND be in the rear half of the lot.
DIMENSIONS: lot_depth, distance_from_street_side_lot_line

Phase 3 - Parking & Access.scope: Allowable placement for uncovered parking areas.
Phase 3 - Parking & Access.applicability: Applies to uncovered parking.
requirements: DIMENSIONS: distance_from_street_side_lot_line

Phase 3 - Parking & Access.scope: Site planning regulations for uncovered, surface parking spaces.
Phase 3 - Parking & Access.applicability: Applies to 'uncovered spaces' for parking, often used as secondary or additional parking spaces as suggested by diagrams. Applies to all lot types for the front yard rule, and specifically to corner lots for the street-side yard rule.
requirements: MANDATORY: Compliance is mandatory. The text uses the word 'must'.

Phase 3 - Parking & Access.scope: Regulates the materials used for driveway surfaces, including restrictions near the public right-of-way.
Phase 3 - Parking & Access.applicability: All driveway surfaces on a property.
requirements: MANDATORY: Materials shall meet Public Works standards. Driveway surface within 10' of the public right-of-way may not be of a loose material (e.g., gravel).
DIMENSIONS: Distance of driveway surface from the public right-of-way.

Phase 3 - Parking & Access.rule_title: Shared Driveway for Second Dwelling Units
Phase 3 - Parking & Access.scope: Regulates driveway access for properties with a second dwelling unit.
Phase 3 - Parking & Access.applicability: Properties with a main dwelling and a second dwelling unit.
requirements: MANDATORY: Second dwelling units must share a common driveway with the main dwelling.

Phase 3 - Parking & Access.scope: Ensures driveways provide safe and practical vehicle access to required parking spaces.
Phase 3 - Parking & Access.applicability: Driveway sections that include turns to provide access to required parking spaces.
requirements: MANDATORY: Turns enroute to required parking spaces must be deemed maneuverable by the Transportation Division.
DIMENSIONS: Turning radius, path of travel, driveway geometry.

Phase 3 - Parking & Access.rule_title: Detached Fireplace as Accessory Structure Calculation
Phase 3 - Parking & Access.scope: Calculation of Floor Area Ratio (FAR) and lot coverage for fireplaces not physically connected to the main house.
Phase 3 - Parking & Access.applicability: Applies to fireplaces treated as accessory structures.
requirements: MANDATORY: Detached fireplaces must always be counted towards lot coverage, regardless of size.
DIMENSIONS: Area (in square feet), size.

Phase 3 - Parking & Access.scope: On-lot parking for residential properties.
Phase 3 - Parking & Access.applicability: Applies per dwelling unit, including 2nd dwelling units.
requirements: MANDATORY: Two spaces are required on the lot per dwelling.

Phase 3 - Parking & Access.scope: Location of required parking spaces on a residential lot.
Phase 3 - Parking & Access.applicability: All required parking spaces.
requirements: MANDATORY: Parking spaces may NOT be located in the required front yard or within the first 10 ft of a required street side yard.

Phase 3 - Parking & Access.scope: Construction of parking garages.
Phase 3 - Parking & Access.applicability: All residential lots.
requirements: MANDATORY: Underground parking garages are prohibited.

Phase 3 - Parking & Access.scope: Type of required parking spaces.
Phase 3 - Parking & Access.applicability: Applies to the two required spaces per dwelling.
requirements: MANDATORY: One of the two required spaces must be covered.

Phase 3 - Parking & Access.scope: Classification of covered-parking structures relative to the main dwelling.
Phase 3 - Parking & Access.applicability: Applies when a covered-parking structure is intended to be classified as 'detached'.

Phase 3 - Parking & Access.scope: Minimum clear internal dimensions for covered parking structures.
Phase 3 - Parking & Access.applicability: Garages, carports, or other covered parking structures.
requirements: MANDATORY: The specified minimum clear internal dimensions must be met for each space.

Phase 3 - Parking & Access.scope: Minimum vertical clearance for parking.
Phase 3 - Parking & Access.applicability: Covered parking structures (garages, carports).
requirements: MANDATORY: The specified minimum vertical clearance must be met.

Phase 3 - Parking & Access.scope: Arrangement of required parking spaces.
Phase 3 - Parking & Access.applicability: Lots with two required spaces where one is covered and one is uncovered.

Phase 3 - Parking & Access.scope: Regulates the allowable placement of detached garages on a residential lot.
Phase 3 - Parking & Access.applicability: Applies to any detached garage, including those for main or second dwelling units. Illustrated in Scenarios A and C.
requirements: VALUES: 75 feet (minimum distance from front lot line)
DIMENSIONS: Distance of the detached garage from the front lot line.

Phase 3 - Parking & Access.scope: Regulates the allowable placement of attached garages on a residential lot.
Phase 3 - Parking & Access.applicability: Applies to any garage that is attached to a dwelling unit. Illustrated in Scenarios B and D.
requirements: MANDATORY: An attached garage MUST be located within the 'buildable area' of the lot.

Phase 3 - Parking & Access.rule_title: Location of Required Uncovered Parking Spaces
Phase 3 - Parking & Access.scope: Defines the prohibited area for satisfying required uncovered parking spaces.
Phase 3 - Parking & Access.applicability: Applies to any required parking space that is not covered (e.g., not in a garage). The text indicates driveways are used for this purpose.
requirements: MANDATORY: Required uncovered parking spaces must be located 'beyond front setback'.

Phase 3 - Parking & Access.rule_title: Minimum Required Parking Spaces per Dwelling (Inferred)
Phase 3 - Parking & Access.scope: Defines the minimum number of parking spaces required for each dwelling on a lot.
Phase 3 - Parking & Access.applicability: Applies to lots containing a main dwelling and a second dwelling unit.
requirements: MANDATORY: Each dwelling unit (main and second) must be provided with the required number of parking spaces.
VALUES: 1 parking space per dwelling unit (Inferred)

Phase 3 - Parking & Access.rule_title: General Standards for All Non-Dwelling Accessory Structures
Phase 3 - Parking & Access.scope: Regulations for accessory structures that are not second-dwelling units.
Phase 3 - Parking & Access.applicability: Applies to all non-dwelling accessory structures on a residential lot.

Phase 3 - Parking & Access.rule_title: Siting of Detached Garages and Carports (General Rule)
Phase 3 - Parking & Access.scope: Site planning regulations for detached accessory parking structures.
Phase 3 - Parking & Access.applicability: Applies to detached garages and carports on lots that are 95' deep or more.
requirements: MANDATORY: Structure must be located in the rear or interior side yard.
VALUES: 75' (minimum distance from front lot line); 20' (minimum distance from street-side lot line).
DIMENSIONS: Location in yard (rear or interior side); Distance from front lot line; Distance from street-side lot line.

Phase 3 - Parking & Access.scope: Location requirements for open-air, uncovered parking spaces.
Phase 3 - Parking & Access.applicability: Applies to uncovered parking spaces.
requirements: MANDATORY: Uncovered spaces must be located 'beyond the required front-yard' AND 'beyond the first 10' of the street-side yard'.
VALUES: 10' (no-parking area measured from the street-side yard).
DIMENSIONS: Location relative to front-yard setback; Location relative to street-side yard.

Phase 4 - Special Features.scope: Allowable setback encroachments for attached storage closets.
Phase 4 - Special Features.applicability: Applies to storage closets attached to the main dwelling.
requirements: MANDATORY: Closet height must be ≤ 6 feet AND closet area must be ≤ 25 square feet.
DIMENSIONS: closet_height, closet_area, encroachment_depth

Phase 4 - Special Features.scope: Allowable setback encroachments for below grade patios.
Phase 4 - Special Features.applicability: Applies to below grade patios with a limited cumulative length.
requirements: MANDATORY: The cumulative length of all such features must be ≤ 5 feet.
DIMENSIONS: encroachment_depth, cumulative_length

Phase 4 - Special Features.scope: Regulations for the design, placement, and dimensions of below-grade patios, including associated lightwells and stairwells, on a residential lot.
Phase 4 - Special Features.applicability: Applies to all excavated features such as below-grade patios. These features are explicitly prohibited on the side of a structure that faces the front yard.
requirements: MANDATORY: Location: Must not be located on the side of the structure that faces the front yard. Separation: Each below-grade area must be separated from another by at least 10 feet. Environmental: Excavated features must not be harmful to neighboring trees. (Flag: 'harmful' is ambiguous and requires definition). Drainage: A drainage system must be installed and approved. Architectural: Must be architecturally compatible with the main residence. (Flag: 'architecturally compatible' is ambiguous and requires definition). Screening: Must be screened from off-site views. Lot Coverage: Any sheltering overhangs or canopies must be included in lot coverage calculations.

Phase 4 - Special Features.scope: Regulations for attached 2nd-dwelling units, subordinate to a main dwelling on a single lot.
Phase 4 - Special Features.applicability: Applies to lots in specified single-family zones (R-1, R-1(7000), R-1(8000), R-1(10000), R-1(20000)) that meet the minimum lot size for the zone.
requirements: MANDATORY: Unit must be subordinate to main dwelling. Lot size must meet minimum for zone. Size must not exceed 450 sf. Height must not exceed 17'. Must have two parking spaces (one covered). Covered parking must not exceed 200 sf. Must be located within setbacks. Counts towards total lot FAR. Basement area counts towards unit size.
DIMENSIONS: lot_size (dependent on zone and lot type); unit_size; basement_area; unit_height; covered_parking_size; total_FAR (Floor Area Ratio).

Phase 4 - Special Features.scope: Regulations for detached 2nd-dwelling units, subordinate to a main dwelling on a single lot.
Phase 4 - Special Features.applicability: Applies to lots in specified single-family zones (R-1, R-1(7000), R-1(8000), R-1(10000), R-1(20000)) that meet the minimum lot size for the zone.
requirements: MANDATORY: Unit must be subordinate to main dwelling. Lot size must meet minimum for zone. Size must not exceed 900 sf. Height must not exceed one story and 17'. Must share driveway with main dwelling. Must have two parking spaces (one covered). Covered parking must not exceed 200 sf. Must be located 12' from main dwelling. Must be located within setbacks. Counts towards total lot FAR. Basement area counts towards unit size. Must be architecturally compatible with main dwelling (AMBIGUOUS).
DIMENSIONS: lot_size (dependent on zone and lot type); unit_size; basement_area; unit_height (stories and feet); covered_parking_size; separation_from_main_dwelling; total_FAR (Floor Area Ratio).

Phase 4 - Special Features.scope: Protection of tree root systems during any excavation activity.
Phase 4 - Special Features.applicability: Applies to all excavation. Protects trees of any species located on the subject property or on abutting lots.
requirements: MANDATORY: It is mandatory to plan excavation to not harm tree roots. It is mandatory for the owner to provide evidence of tree protection.
DIMENSIONS: Typical root depth ('first 18” below grade'), excavation slope (e.g., '1:1 slope').

Phase 4 - Special Features.rule_title: Location Restriction for Appendages and Noise-Producing Equipment
Phase 4 - Special Features.scope: Placement and location of miscellaneous appendages and noise-producing equipment.
Phase 4 - Special Features.applicability: Applies to appendages (e.g., tool sheds, equipment enclosures, play houses) and any noise-producing equipment.
requirements: MANDATORY: Prohibited from locating these items in required yards.

Phase 4 - Special Features.scope: Regulations governing the physical location (siting) of noise-producing equipment on a property.
Phase 4 - Special Features.applicability: Applies to all service equipment, including but not limited to pool equipment, air conditioning units, and generators. Also applies to the replacement of existing equipment.
requirements: MANDATORY: ['All service equipment must meet the City’s Noise Ordinance (Chapter 9.10 of the Municipal Code).', 'Equipment may not be located in front, rear, or interior-side yards.', 'Equipment must be insulated and housed (subject to waiver exception).']

DIMENSIONS: [{'name': 'equipment_location', 'description': 'The designated yard or area where the equipment is placed.', 'values': ['front yard', 'rear yard', 'interior-side yard', 'street-side yard', 'buildable area']}, {'name': 'street_side_yard_encroachment', 'description': 'The distance equipment may encroach into a street-side yard.', 'unit': 'feet'}, {'name': 'driveway_clearance', 'description': 'Minimum clear distance required for a driveway, as shown in an example.', 'unit': 'feet'}]

Phase 5 - Final Review.scope: Defines mandatory locational and dimensional constraints for all basements.
requirements: MANDATORY: Basements must not be located in special flood hazard areas. Basements must not extend beyond the building footprint. Basements must not encroach into required yards.
DIMENSIONS: Building footprint, Required yards, Rear yard.

Phase 5 - Final Review.scope: Allowable setback encroachments for eaves and cornices.
requirements: DIMENSIONS: encroachment_depth

Phase 5 - Final Review.scope: Allowable placement for pools and spas.
Phase 5 - Final Review.applicability: Applies to the main body of pools and spas.
requirements: DIMENSIONS: distance_to_rear_lot_line, distance_to_interior_side_lot_line

Phase 5 - Final Review.scope: Allowable setback encroachments for fireplaces in side yards.
Phase 5 - Final Review.applicability: Applies to fireplaces of a specific width.
requirements: MANDATORY: Fireplace width must be ≤ 5 feet.
DIMENSIONS: fireplace_width, encroachment_depth

Phase 5 - Final Review.scope: Allowable setback encroachments for excavated lightwells and stairwells.
Phase 5 - Final Review.applicability: Applies to lightwells and stairwells with a limited cumulative length.
requirements: MANDATORY: The cumulative length of all such features must be ≤ 15 feet.
DIMENSIONS: encroachment_depth, cumulative_length

Phase 5 - Final Review.rule_title: Exemption for Unusable Attic in Historic Homes
Phase 5 - Final Review.scope: Provides a partial exemption for unusable attic space in historic homes.
Phase 5 - Final Review.applicability: Applies to unusable attic space in Category 1 & 2 historic homes.

Phase 5 - Final Review.scope: Standards governing the dimensional requirements for carports, including open sides and vertical clearance.
Phase 5 - Final Review.applicability: Applies to the design and construction of carports, specifically covered parking spaces intended for vehicles.

Phase 5 - Final Review.scope: Regulates the placement, spacing, and number of curb cuts along a property's frontage.
Phase 5 - Final Review.applicability: All properties with frontage on a public street where curb cuts are proposed or exist.
requirements: MANDATORY: A minimum of 20' must be maintained between curb cuts.
DIMENSIONS: Distance between curb cuts, Distance from curb cut to intersection curb face.

Phase 5 - Final Review.scope: Governs any work performed within the public right-of-way.
Phase 5 - Final Review.applicability: Construction or modification activities, such as creating a curb cut or driveway apron, that occur in the public ROW.
requirements: MANDATORY: A street-work permit must be obtained. Work must comply with city standards.

Phase 5 - Final Review.rule_title: Guard Rail Architectural Compatibility and Landscape Screening
Phase 5 - Final Review.scope: Design of guard rails and installation of landscape screening related to excavation.
Phase 5 - Final Review.applicability: Applies to any project where an excavation requires a guard rail, or where the Planning Dept. deems landscape screening necessary.
requirements: MANDATORY: If a guard rail is required, it MUST be designed to be architecturally compatible with the residence.

Phase 5 - Final Review.rule_title: Prohibition on Construction of New Wood-Burning Fireplaces
Phase 5 - Final Review.scope: Prohibition of the construction of new wood-burning fireplaces.
Phase 5 - Final Review.applicability: City of Palo Alto. Applies to new construction.
requirements: MANDATORY: Construction of new wood-burning fireplaces is prohibited.

Phase 5 - Final Review.rule_title: Determination of Open/Closed Status for Perimeter Segments
Phase 5 - Final Review.scope: This rule defines the procedure for classifying perimeter segments of a structure (e.g., a porch) as either 'open' or 'closed'.
Phase 5 - Final Review.applicability: Applies to all perimeter segments of a structure's design plan.

Phase 5 - Final Review.scope: Standards for the design, placement, and dimensions of excavated features such as light wells and stairwells.
Phase 5 - Final Review.applicability: Applies to all excavated features (light wells, stairwells) on a property, particularly in relation to required yards and setbacks.
requirements: MANDATORY: The drainage system for the features must be approved by the Public Works Department.
